column4: I have a mac hfs+ USB stick that I need to write to in Ubuntu but for the life of me I can't. Can anyone help.
there is a driver for it here http://sourceforge.net/projects/linux-hfsplus/
I installed that but I still can't write.
wait let me look at that carefully maybe I didn't install that
have you considered formatting the drive and use an filesystem Linux and OSX can handle? Like fat32.
well they must support have a FS in common that will handle large files
hmm, dunno. it would be great if it was HFS+ though. I read that ubuntu can mount and r/w hfs+ parts but for some reason I can't get read privilges on this usb stick
I hope you get the driver working. I don't have a mac, so never faced that problem before.
thanks
you still here?
yeah sorry, was away for a bit
so you can read, but not write?
yes, I can read. ( i presume as it is empty) . sudo mount -t hfsplus /dev/sdd2 /media/mac is what I am typing to mount.
I'm not a guru on these things, and other members can join in. But have you tried chmod 777 the folder it's mounted too.
when I mount, it shows it as being owned by root so I can't write to it.  Let me try chmod. I tried chowning it.
have you tried open Nautilus as root and then trying to write too it?
no..will try next
try writing to it as root (alt+f2 gksu nautilus). That way we can determin if it's a driver issue or a permission one
ok will do
well that seems to be doing something. hmm so I guess it was permissions
at least you got it working :p
yeah, thanks millions for your help. I don't use these commands too often so I forget all the ins and outs
no prob, that's why I'm here
